It is the primary airport of North-East India, and the 12th busiest airport in India . It is located at Borjhar , 26 km (16 mi) from Dispur , the capital city of Assam and 28 km (18 mi) from Guwahati. It is named after Gopinath Bordoloi , a freedom fighter and the first Chief Minister of Assam after India's independence.
